meanings.definition: To have on one's body as clothing
meanings.sent1: I wear my favorite blue shirt to school every Monday.
meanings.sent2: She likes to wear a warm sweater in the winter.
meanings.sent3: Why does the superhero wear a cape to bed?
meanings.sent4: His smile is like a badge he wears proudly.
meanings.sent5: The princess wears a crown made of flowers.

meanings.definition: To deteriorate or diminish through use
meanings.sent1: The old book shows signs of wear on its cover.
meanings.sent2: The tires on the car wear out after many miles of driving.
meanings.sent3: The toy bear started to wear down after years of play.
meanings.sent4: His patience began to wear thin as the meeting dragged on.
meanings.sent5: The constant rain can wear away the rocks over time.

meanings.sent1: I can wear the cold weather better with a thick jacket.
meanings.sent2: She can wear the spicy food without any problem.
meanings.sent3: He decided to wear the boring lecture for the sake of his friend.
meanings.sent4: She wears the pain of her past with grace and strength.
meanings.sent5: The soldier must wear the harsh conditions of battle.

meanings.definition: To exhibit or present a particular appearance or expression
meanings.sent1: The actor knows how to wear a confident smile on stage.
meanings.sent2: She can wear a look of surprise like no one else.
meanings.sent3: The magician will wear a mysterious expression during the trick.
meanings.sent4: His words wear a cloak of wisdom beyond his years.
meanings.sent5: The painting wears the colors of a beautiful sunset.
